title: Ticket #6696: Fedora 28's compiler breaks shared port.
description: We crash on start-up with shared port enabled because condor_io/shared_port_client.cpp:657 attempts to take the address of the first element of an empty vector. This used to work (especially since the vector was reserved() to the right size), but C++ does not require it to work, and when built on Fedora 28, it doesn't anymore.
